example.description: Sets the specified description for the AMI with ID "ami-1a2b3c4d".

This example adds the "774F4FF8" product code to the AMI with ID "ami-1a2b3c4d". The -Attribute parameter and "productCodes" value can be omitted but if specified, the value for the parameter is case sensitive.
This example makes the AMI public (for example, so any AWS account can use it). Note that the value for the -Attribute parameter is case-sensitive.
This example makes the AMI private (for example, so that only you as the owner can use it). Note that the value for the -Attribute parameter is case-sensitive.
This example grants launch permission to the AWS account with ID 111122223333. Note that the value for the -Attribute parameter is case-sensitive.
This example removes launch permission from the AWS account with ID 111122223333. Note that the value for the -Attribute parameter is case-sensitive.
